2143.subject: BUS
2143.descrlong: Language competencies are built through written assignments involving critical analysis, reasoning & research. Oral proficiency is developed through self-critique & instructor feedback. The course includes role-play, debate, case study analyses, & class discussions.  Students are introduced to ethical frameworks with which to analyze multiple perspectives on current issues.  The readings & case studies illustrate ethical dilemmas & require critical examination of societal implications.
